about:
Dr. ir. Rob Roggema is Distinguished Professor of Regenerative Culture at Tecnologico de Monterrey, Mexico and Founder of Cittaideale, office for adaptive planning and design research. He is visiting professor at Queens University Belfast. He is a Landscape Architect and an internationally renowned design-expert on sustainable urbanism, climate adaptation, energy landscapes and urban agriculture. He has previously held positions at universities in the Netherlands and Australia, State and Municipal governments and design consultancies. Rob developed the Swarm Planning concept, a dynamic way of planning the city for future adaptation to climate change impacts. about:
Ivan Henriques is a transdisciplinary artist and researcher working in multimedia installations examining systems. He explores in his works hybrids of living and non-living systems creating novel approaches to investigate endangered and inhospitable ecosystems. Throughout his works he develops ways to enhance the communication between humans, other living organisms and the environment. He considers nature as inspiration and a necessary force and knowledge to shift the human-centered development of the technological world. Ivan is the coordinator and founder of interdisciplinary research groups as Hybrid Forms Lab (hybridformslab.org) and is the creator and coordinator of the mobile residency program EME (Estúdio Móvel Experimental -emedata.blogspot.com).
